SENT.plain: A 21-year-old woman was admitted with right hemiparesis, bilateral papilledema, negative myoclonus of right upper extremity, and bilateral pyramidal findings
An MRI showed no venous flow in the inferior sagittal sinus
Lipoprotein a (Lp [a]) level was high and iron deficiency anemia (IDA) was found
The coexistence of IDA and Lp (a) in patients with cerebral venous thrombosis is a very rare condition in adult patients
These risk factors should be investigated in patients with cerebral venous thrombosis
